getMarketData

public Data getMarketData(java.lang.String market,
                          int startMonth,
                          int startDay,
                          int startYear)
Gets the value and volume data from the requested markets (by calling dataParser() ), then determines how many distribution days there have been in the last 4 weeks. A distribution day is defined as a day when value decreased and volume increased, with the threshold set at less than 4. Boolean is saved in the marketStatus HashMap.

Returns:
true if less than 4 d-days, false otherwise
Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.net.URISyntaxException

urlContentToString

public static java.lang.String urlContentToString(java.lang.String url,
                                                  java.lang.String cookie)
                                           throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                                  java.net.URISyntaxException,
                                                  java.io.IOException
Converts the contents of a URL to a String

Parameters:
url - the URL to be read from
needsCookie - indicates a need for a cookie to access secure content, such as subscription stock data on investors.com
Returns:
String representation of the site's content
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException
java.net.URISyntaxException
java.io.IOException

getMC

public static long getMC(java.lang.String tick)
                  throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                         java.net.URISyntaxException,
                         java.io.IOException
Extracts market capitalization value for given tick symbol. Accesses yahoo.com and parses data page, extracts market capitalization value and converts to long. Note: this method is not currently used, since S&P500 is the only market used currently.

Parameters:
tick - represents the stock for which market cap is to be acquired
Returns:
the market cap value
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException
java.net.URISyntaxException
java.io.IOException

getParams

public ibd.web.patterns.DataRetriever.StockParameters getParams(java.lang.String str)
Retrieves values for each of the 5 IBD rating values, saves them in a String array, then uses the StockParameters inner class constructor to parse and save them in their proper form.

Parameters:
str - the string representing the content of an individual stock's IBD data page.
Returns:
an instance of the StockParameters class, which encloses a stock's rating values.

dataParser

public Data dataParser(java.lang.String symbol,
                       java.lang.String url)
                throws java.net.MalformedURLException,
                       java.io.IOException,
                       java.net.URISyntaxException
reads data from the specified URL, parses price and volume data and stores them in the Data class.

Parameters:
url - the URL to read from
days - the number of previous days from which data should be gathered
Returns:
an instance of the Data class, containing an array of prices and an array of corresponding volumes
Throws:
java.net.MalformedURLException
java.io.IOException
java.net.URISyntaxException

getYahooURL

public static java.lang.String getYahooURL(java.lang.String market,
                                           int days)
Builds url for 4 weeks of market data on yahoo.com. The url contains values for the starting year, month and day and ending year, month and day for the requested data.

Parameters:
market - the market for which data is desired
Returns:
a String representing the constructed url

buildYahooUrl

public static java.lang.String buildYahooUrl(java.lang.String market,
                                             int startMonth,
                                             int startDay,
                                             int startYear)
